headline: Warren Buffett Just Hit the Buy Button for $563 Million. Is the Oracle of Omaha Starting to See Value in the Stock Market?
summary: Warren Buffett's company Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) has been stockpiling cash all year.  At the end of the third quarter of 2024, Berkshire had over $320 billion of cash and short-term Treasury bills.  Recently, however, Buffett and Berkshire scooped up $563 million of stock in three companies, disclosures Berkshire had to make because it already holds more than a 10% stake in each one.
